intro: Sterigmapetalum guianense subsp. guianense, commonly known as the Guianese star-petalled plant, is a member of the Malvaceae family. It is characterized by its striking, star-shaped flowers that typically display a vibrant pink or red color. The plant is native to the rainforests of South America, particularly in Guyana and northern Brazil. It has palmate leaves with five to seven lobes, and its structure is adapted to thrive in humid, shaded environments. The species is noted for its ornamental value and is sometimes cultivated for its aesthetic appeal.
